intro: Hymenoxys virgata, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow with a yellow center, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Hymenoxys virgata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
